p:
During the last interglacial (~130,000 years ago), the Osorno area experienced intense volcanic activity from the Andean arc located ~100 km to the east (Fig. 1a). This volcanic activity deposited a series of volcanoclastic flows (50-m minimum thickness) at Secuencia San Pablo
38 , which form the hills north of Osorno and the lowermost unit at the Pilauco site. Consequently, all strata sampled at Pilauco contain abundant multi-cm-sized clasts of volcanic basalt and tuff.
